conbody.p: There are a great deal of other request headers available. Some of them simply affect the transfer of data between the server and client, and should not affect the application at all. For example, Accept-Encoding informs the server which compression schemes the client understands, and Host informs the server which virtual host to serve up.

Other headers do affect the application, but are automatically read by Yesod. For example, the Accept-Language header specifies which human language (English, Spanish, German, Swiss-German) the client prefers. See the i18n chapter for details on how this header is used.
